main event: On 21 April 1949, at approximately 2140 CST, an observer at Enid Air Force Base, Oklahoma, witnessed a white opalescent ball with a tail flying horizontally at supersonic speed.
interesting points: The object was seen for about 2 seconds before fading from view., The observer estimated the object's distance from themselves to be approximately 2000 feet., The object appeared to be the size of a large opalescent light globe when observed from a distance of 15 feet., No other witnesses were reported to have seen the object., The observer's reliability is marked as above reproach, with normal vision and flying experience.
sighted object: a white opalescent ball with a tail
location: Enid Air Force Base, Oklahoma, USA
witness description: Lt. Col. [REDACTED], a pilot with over 2000 flying hours, stated they had not previously reported similar phenomena.
